verses.text: If a wise man goes to court with a fool, the fool rages and scoffs, and there is no peace.
Bloodthirsty men hate a man of integrity and seek to kill the upright.
A fool gives full vent to his anger, but a wise man keeps himself under control.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 29:9
rsbNotes.text: 29:9 If at all possible, the wise should avoid disputing with fools. Fools are incapable of rational argument, and even when right judgment is given they cannot be reconciled. See note 26:4, 5.
